definitions.text: an often persistent bodily disorder or disease; a cause for complaining
affected by an impairment of normal physical or mental function
examples: ill from the monotony of his suffering
it's an ill wind that blows no good
you certainly did me an ill turn
my words with inauspicious thunderings shook heaven
a dead and ominous silence prevailed
a by-election at a time highly unpropitious for the Government

definitions.text: (`ill' is often used as a combining form) in a poor or improper or unsatisfactory manner; not well
examples: it ill befits a man to betray old friends
he performed badly on the exam
tried not to speak ill of the dead
thought badly of him for his lack of concern

definitions.text: with difficulty or inconvenience; scarcely or hardly
examples: we can ill afford to buy a new car just now
